conclusion: Analyze the path of the liquid from each source (A, B, C, and D) as it interacts with the baffles to determine which container (E or F) the liquid will flow into.
Source A (yellow liquid) flows from the top and hits the first baffle, which is angled downwards to the right.
The yellow liquid follows the baffle and moves downwards to the right.
The yellow liquid continues to flow downwards, eventually reaching the bottom section where it is directed towards container F.
Source B (white liquid) flows from the top and hits the second baffle, which is angled downwards to the right.
The white liquid follows the baffle and moves downwards to the right.
The white liquid continues to flow downwards, eventually reaching the bottom section where it is directed towards container F.
Source C (green liquid) flows from the top and hits the third baffle, which is angled downwards to the left.
The green liquid follows the baffle and moves downwards to the left.
The green liquid continues to flow downwards, eventually reaching the bottom section where it is directed towards container E.
Source D (blue liquid) flows from the top and hits the fourth baffle, which is angled downwards to the right.
The blue liquid follows the baffle and moves downwards to the right.
The blue liquid continues to flow downwards, eventually reaching the bottom section where it is directed towards container F.
The liquid from sources A, B, and D will flow into container F, and the liquid from source C will flow into container E.
